title: Central Bank refutes money printing claims
byline: The claims on money printing are not accurate and are baseless, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) said.

title: Tharjini offers to rebuild Sri Lanka Netball
byline: Former Sri Lanka ace goal shooter Tharjini Sivalingam said she is ready to coach the national netball team if the governing body invites her.

title: Government expecting to reduce electricity tariffs by considerable amount: President
byline: The government is focused on significant issues such as lowering energy prices, promoting foreign investments and restructuring the diplomatic service to facilitate enhancing market access, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: National Digital ID initiative to be completed within one-and-half years: President
byline: While highlighting the critical importance of digitising Sri Lanka’s economy, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said the implementation of a National Digital ID initiative will be completed within one-and-a-half years.

title: No money for public servants’ pay hike announced by previous Government: Vijitha
byline: The government reiterated today that no financial allocation had been made for any pay hike for public servants in keeping with the recommendations by the committee headed by Udaya R. Senevirathne despite a Cabinet decision taken by the previous rule.

title: Housemaid arrested for stealing pilot’s luggage
byline: Katunayaka, October 29 (Daily Mirror) - A 45-year-old Sri Lanka housemaid was arrested by airport police for stealing the luggage of a Colombian pilot.

title: Station Masters on strike tomorrow if President, Minister do not address their issues
byline: If the President and the Minister do not address the administrative issues within the Railways Department, the Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union (SLRSMU) has decided to launch a trade union action tomorrow.

title: Arugam Bay incident suspects held for 90 Days under Detention Order
byline: Two suspects arrested in connection with security threats to foreign tourists in the Arugam Bay area are being detained for 90 days for further questioning, investigators informed court.

title: Student discovers lost Mayan city in Mexico jungle by accident
byline: A huge Maya city has been discovered centuries after it disappeared under jungle canopy in Mexico.

title: Magazine found on Beliatta-Kandy express train
byline: An ammunition magazine was found on an express train scheduled to leave from Beliatta to Kandy a short while ago, the Railways Department reported.

title: Hezbollah elects Naim Qassem to succeed slain head Nasrallah
byline: Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said on Tuesday it had elected deputy head Naim Qassem to succeed slain secretary general Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli air attack on Beirut’s southern suburb over a month ago.

title: Ranil named respondent in FR petition challenging Deshabandu’s appointment as IGP
byline: The Supreme Court today permitted the petitioners to add former President Ranil Wickremesinghe as a respondent in a Fundamental Rights petition filed challenging the appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as the Inspector General of Police (IGP).

title: Johnston Fernando writes letter from prison?
byline: The Department of Prisons today denied reports claiming that former Minister Johnston Fernando, currently in remand custody, had written a letter from prison.

title: 570 train derailments reported since 2020
byline: A total of 570 train derailment incidents, including those on railway lines and in railway yards, have been reported since 2020, according to the Railways Department.

title: Police on alert over alleged tourist activities in Arugam Bay
byline: Police have initiated investigations into reports of tourists, including Israeli nationals, allegedly engaging in activities outside of leisure, such as business and religious practices, while on tourist visas in Arugam Bay.

title: Apply for passports only for urgent needs
byline: Cabinet spokesman and Minister Vijitha Herath today requested that public to apply for passports at the Immigration & Emigration Department only for urgent matters.

title: Contract awarded to M/s OQ Trading for 2025 LPG supply to Litro Gas
byline: Approval has been granted to award the contract to M/s. OQ Trading Limited for the supply of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to Litro Gas, Sri Lanka for the year 2025, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Lanka T10 Super League Player Draft set for November 10
byline: The Player Draft for the inaugural Lanka T10 Super League will take place on November 10, 2024, in Colombo, the Sri Lanka Cricket said.

title: Government refutes printing money, obtaining foreign loans
byline: While refuting reports of printing money under the new government, Cabinet spokesman Minister Vijitha Herath said today the government had neither printed money nor obtained loans from foreign countries or institutions.

title: Sale, distribution of pork suspended
byline: A new gazette notification has been issued declaring all Divisional Secretary’s divisions in the country as “infected” or “suspected” areas due to the recent reports of African Swine Fever (ASF) outbreaks among pigs.

title: 150 injured in Kerala cracker tragedy, eyewitnesses recall ’’Ball Of Fire’’
byline: More than 150 people were injured, 10 of them seriously, in a fireworks accident at a temple in Kerala’s Kasaragod district late last night. Shocking visuals from the spot showed crackers triggering a massive fire and a cloud of smoke as people gathered on the temple premises ran to safety.

title: Showers likely today in Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-Western Provinces
byline: Showers above 40 mm are likely in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-Western Provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts during the evening or night, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Australia T20 World Cup winner retires from international cricket
byline: Australia veteran and ICC Men’s T20 World Cup winner Matthew Wade has announced his retirement from international cricket.

title: Beware of ’Evil Twin’ attacks when using public Wi-Fi networks
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) is urging the public to exercise caution when using public Wi-Fi networks due to the risk of ’Evil Twin’ attacks.

title: Former Pradeshiya Sabha member murdered in Kegalle
byline: A former Kegalle Pradeshiya Sabha member of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna was found murdered in his home in Kossinna, Kegalle, police said.

title: Rs. 10 million contract killing averted
byline: An individual suspected of preparing to destroy a woman on a contract of Rs. 10 million was taken into custody by the Organised Crime Investigation Unit of the CID during a raid in Habaraduwa area.

title: NGOs spend billions unchecked
byline: The local and international NGOs registered with the National NGO Secretariat - have committed to spend as much as Rs.30 billion this year, yet more than double this amount is spent by such organisations which are unregistered, warranting the need to enact the proposed NGO Regulation and Supervision Bill as early as possible, an informed source said.

title: Sri Lanka exceeds last October’s tourist arrivals in first 27 days of month
byline: Sri Lanka surpassed last October’s total tourist arrivals within the first 27 days of this month, indicating the potential for a double-digit growth trajectory.

title: Sri Lanka must shift to trade-oriented production to manage debt post-IMF: Economist
byline: As Sri Lanka prepares to resume repayment of its significant sovereign debt by 2028, a leading economist has called for a strategic shift towards trade-oriented production, to secure a primary surplus essential for debt management, once the International Monetary Fund (IMF) programme concludes.

title: Socialist parties in Sri Lanka facing new challenge: NPP
byline: The National People’s Party (NPP) which obtained a single seat at the Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha elections held yesterday, said people have made it clear in recent times that socialist parties cannot run a government effectively and safeguard its socialist ideology at the same time.

title: No title
byline: No byline
